result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: SPD Appointment - Attorney Robert Thorson
Status conference on November 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Cases called at 3:01 PM: 22CF331, 22CF1011. Hearing held via Zoom and in person.
Defendant Marty L. Monhead appeared by video, in custody from the Eau Claire County Jail.  Attorney James H Krave appeared by video for Marty L. Monhead.  Attorney Monica Fallon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives their right to appear in person and Court accepts waiver. 
Defendant is advised of charges/potential penalties, waives reading of Information, and enters Not Guilty pleas. 
Attorney Krave moves to withdraw as he is retiring. Court approves request. Attorney Krave to file Motion to Withdraw and Public Defender to appoint new counsel.
STC: 11/22/22 at 10:30 AM (In person).
Same as Complaint.
Arraignment on October 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Arraignment on October 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

(2:49 PM cases 22CF331, 22CF1011 called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. 
Defendant Marty L. Monhead in court, in custody. Attorney James H Krave appeared by video for Marty L. Monhead. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives right to a personal appearance and wants to proceed. Court accepts the defendant's waiver to a personal appearance.
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in cases 22CF331, 22CF1011 and Court accepts waivers. 
Attorney Krave to schedule an Arraignment in cases 22CF331, 22CF1011 with Branch 3 Judicial Assistant.

Order on Request to Appear Remotely
The Court Orders: Attorney James Krave may appear via Video Zoom for the proceeding scheduled on 09/20/2022. See order for further details.
Dated 09/16/2022, Letter from Attorney James Krave to Court requesting to appear by Zoom for 09/20/2022 hearing.

2:05 PM cases 22CF331, 22CF1011 called. Defendant Marty L. Monhead in court, in custody.  Attorney James H Krave not in court.  Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. 
The State advises Attorney Krave was in an accident on his way to court. Court finds good cause to continue to another date.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

(11:45 AM cases 22CF331, 22CF1011 called.) Defendant Marty L. Monhead appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Law Intern David Carlson, supervised by Attorney Sonia L Anderson appeared by video for Marty L. Monhead. Prosecuting attorney Andrew Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court orders the warrant is quashed.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaints.
Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation.
State requests $5,000.00 cash bond and cites reasoning. Defense requests signature bond and cites reasoning.
Court orders $2,500.00 cash bond with conditions to cover both cases.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Conditions:
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
No use or possession of any dangerous weapons. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level. 
(Covers 22CF331, 22CF1011)
